name: deploy-gke-build-task
author: Google Cloud Tools
description: Deploys a Docker image from Google Container Registry to Google Container Engine.

inputs.name: serviceEndpoint
inputs.label: GCP connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: The Google Cloud Platform connection to use.

inputs.name: zone
inputs.label: Zone
inputs.helpMarkDown: The zone the cluster resides in.

inputs.name: cluster
inputs.label: Cluster Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the cluster to deploy to.

inputs.name: deployType
inputs.label: Deploy using
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use Configuration File if you have a kubernetes configuration file you wish to apply.

inputs.name: configPath
inputs.label: Config file path
inputs.helpMarkDown: The path of the kubernetes config file that defines your deployment. JSON and YAML formats accepted.

inputs.name: updateTag
inputs.label: Update Image Tag
inputs.helpMarkDown: Check this if you want to modify your config file by changing the tag of an image before deploying.

inputs.name: deploymentName
inputs.label: Deployment Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the deployment to run or update.

inputs.name: imageName
inputs.label: Image Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the container image to deploy.

inputs.name: imageTag
inputs.label: Image Tag
inputs.helpMarkDown: The tag of the image to deploy.

inputs.name: replicas
inputs.label: Number of Replicas
inputs.helpMarkDown: The number of replicas to run.

inputs.name: dryRun
inputs.label: Dry Run
inputs.helpMarkDown: With dry run selected, no changes will actually be made to your cluster
